name: Upload to OSS
info:
Upload an object. If the specified object name already exists in 
the bucket, the uploaded content will overwrite the existing content 
for the bucket name/object name combination.

### Parameters

* **bucket**: bucket to upload object into

* **key**: object name being uploaded

* **contentType** [optional]: media type

* **contentDisposition** [optional]: suggested default filename when downloading this object to a file after it has been uploaded

* **ifMatch** [optional]: When overwriting an object, use the latest SHA-1 hash 
  to verify that you are overwriting the latest data.
  A SHA-1 hash is returned every time you upload or overwrite an object. 
  If the SHA-1 hash in the header does not match the current SHA-1 hash 
  stored for this object in OSS, the request fails (status code 412).

### Outputs

* **response**: the object details
  The node will add the ```objectId```, ```base64``` and ```safe base64``` **```urn```** to the message.

* **error**: an error occured

name: Get URN
safe base64
Inject
info:
Upload an object. If the specified object name already exists in 
the bucket, the uploaded content will overwrite the existing content 
for the bucket name/object name combination.

### Parameters

* **bucket**: bucket to upload object into

* **key**: object name being uploaded

* **contentType** [optional]: indicate the media type of the resource

* **contentDisposition** [optional]: suggested default filename when 
  downloading this object

* **ifMatch** [optional]: When overwriting an object, use the latest SHA-1 
  hash to verify that you are overwriting the latest data.
  A SHA-1 hash is returned every time you upload or overwrite an object. 
  If the SHA-1 hash in the header does not match the current SHA-1 hash 
  stored for this object in OSS, the request fails (status code 412).

### Outputs:

name: OSS Object Exists?
info:
Check if an object exists

### Parameters

* **bucket**: bucket key

* **key**: object name to get details for

* **sha1** [optional]: use the SHA-1 hash to know if the file is the same

* **ifModifiedSince** [optional]: If the requested object has not been modified 
  since the time specified in this field, an entity will not be returned 
  from the server; instead, a 304 (not modified) response will be 
  returned without any message body. (HTTP date - UTC format)

### Outputs

* **sameObject**: SHA-1 code was provided and the object on the server match that code
  The node will add the ```objectId```, ```base64``` and ```safe base64``` **```urn```** to the message.

* **needsUpdate**:  SHA-1 code was provided and the object on the server does not match that code
  The node will add the ```objectId```, ```base64``` and ```safe base64``` **```urn```** to the message.

* **notFound**: the object was not found on the server

* **error**: an error occured

name: Inject
Get URN
safe base64
Get URN
safe base64
Check or Create OSS Bucket
info:
Check and Create OSS Bucket

### Parameters

* **bucket**: A unique name you assign to a bucket. It must be globally 
  unique across all applications and regions, otherwise the call will 
  fail. Possible values: -_.a-z0-9 (between 3-128 characters in
  length). Note that you cannot change a bucket key.

* **region** [optional]: The region where the bucket resides Acceptable values: 
  ```US```, ```EMEA``` Default: ```US```

* **policyKey** [optional]: Data retention policy - Acceptable values: transient, temporary, persistent.
  Default: ```transient```.

* **forceBucketCreation** [optional] : In case the bucketKey is already used by another
  application, you can force the node to iterate and find a name. The 
  node will append 6 random characters to the given key until it finds
  one. Default: ```false```

### Outputs

* **response**: the bucket details

* **error**: an error occured

Styling
format:
<script id="forgeStyles" type="text/javascript">
html, body, div, span, applet, object, iframe,
h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, p, blockquote, pre,
a, abbr, acronym, address, big, cite, code,
del, dfn, em, img, ins, kbd, q, s, samp,
small, strike, strong, sub, sup, tt, var,
b, u, i, center,
dl, dt, dd, ol, ul, li,
fieldset, form, label, legend,
table, caption, tbody, tfoot, thead, tr, th, td,
article, aside, canvas, details, embed, 
figure, figcaption, footer, header, hgroup, 
menu, nav, output, ruby, section, summary,
time, mark, audio, video {
	margin: 0;
	padding: 0;
	border: 0;
	font-size: 100%;
	font: inherit;
	vertical-align: baseline;
}
/* HTML5 display-role reset for older browsers */
article, aside, details, figcaption, figure, 
footer, header, hgroup, menu, nav, section {
	display: block;
}
body {
	line-height: 1;
}
ol, ul {
	list-style: none;
}
blockquote, q {
	quotes: none;
}
blockquote:before, blockquote:after,
q:before, q:after {
	content: '';
	content: none;
}
table {
	border-collapse: collapse;
	border-spacing: 0;
}

$('.nr-dashboard-theme md-select-menu md-option[selected]').css({ 'background-color': '#3f3f3f !important' });

// var stylesheet = document.styleSheets[0],
//     selector = ".abc", rule = "{color: red}";

// if (stylesheet.insertRule) {
//     stylesheet.insertRule(selector + rule, stylesheet.cssRules.length);
// } else if (stylesheet.addRule) {
//     stylesheet.addRule(selector, rule, -1);
// }

table.trace-table {
    color: #333;
    font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
    width: 100%;
    border-collapse: collapse;
    border-spacing: 0;
    overflow-x: auto;
    overflow-y: auto;
}
table.trace-table tr td,
table.trace-table tr th {
    border: 1px solid transparent;
    /* No more visible border */
    height: 30px;
    transition: all 0.3s;
    /* Simple transition for hover effect */
}
table.trace-table tr th {
    background: #DFDFDF;
    /* Darken header a bit */
    font-weight: bold;
}
table.trace-table tr td {
    background: #FAFAFA;
    text-align: center;
}

table.trace-table tr:nth-child(even) td {
    background: gray;
}

tr:nth-child(odd) table.trace-table td {
    background: blue;
}
table.trace-table tr td:hover {
    background: red;
    color: yellow;
}


</script>
